instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen w/lines after waking from sleep
threads.message:
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Liquid damaged. Replaced a few corroded caps and resistors, replaced burned LCD connector and LCD cable. Had no video internal or external, replaced <CHIP>U8300</CHIP>.

Everything working fine now except screen is black with backlight on and about 1" of faint vertical lines when waking from sleep. 

Appreciate any help solving this.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen w/lines after waking from sleep
threads.message: Looks like a bad LCD. Make sure it is not just an LCD problem.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Black screen w/lines after waking from sleep
threads.message: Thanks Duke. Figured it out. Same thing with another LCD. <CHIP>U8300</CHIP> was pulled from a scrap board, replacing it again solved the problem.
